definitions.definition: the buildings of a university or college and the land around them

examples.text: The university has campuses in Cairns and Brisbane.
She lives on campus *(= within the main university area)*.
The number of graduate students living off campus has dropped.
Students at the main campus have heeded the call to boycott lectures.
Wi-fi is also provided in many locations around the campus.
The statue stands on the campus of Princeton University.
Students at the Belfast campus have access to excellent sports facilities.
The Engineering department is on the main campus.

wordOrigin: late 18th cent. (originally US): from Latin campus ‘field’, specifically applied to the Campus Martius in Rome, used for games, athletic practice, and military drill.
